website_summaries.verdict: The BenQ MX662 is a bright, capable XGA data projector with a good range of connection choices.
pros: Can run presentations from a USB thumb drive

customer_reviews.title: Display is big, sharp, bright.
customer_reviews.text: I'm using this at my church to project song lyrics. It makes a HUGE, BRIGHT display on the painted wall, and the adjustments for throwing it up high (keystone) are right on the remote making it easy if you move it around, and it retains the keystone setting even though we kick off the power to it every week. It runs quiet enough, with no cycle up/down distractions. I'm using this with a 100' HDMI cable with no problems.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Bembower

customer_reviews.title: Died too soon!
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this projector in 2014 and liked it a lot. Unfortunately, it died after 24 months of very light use (perhaps 100 hours total). $10/hour depreciation is a little steep!
customer_reviews.author: Mysticpass

customer_reviews.title: Not Bright Enough
customer_reviews.text: First bulb lasted 325 hours. The projector seems to be less bright than it was when we bought it, even with a new bulb. Our installation is in a 35' x 40' auditorium. Can not see colors without turning the house lights off. When we want to see good colors, everyone in the congregation turns around and looks at our LCD monitor at the back of the Sanctuary.
customer_reviews.author: Bob L.

product_meta.title: BenQ MX662 3500 Lumen XGA SmartEco 3D DLP Projector
product_meta.description:
The BenQ MX662 is just the projector you need in any setting. Featuring XGA resolution, 3500 ANSI lumens, and 13000:1 contrast ratio, the MX662 also offers multi display support for ultra-smooth connection. The MX662 also supports PC-less presentation and 3D! As the first DLP brand to incorporate Philips' ImageCare technology into its projector lamp system, BenQ has taken the next step in developing its own SmartEco Technology. The MX662 brings together uncompromised brightness, exquisite picture quality, and optimized lamp life through Smarteco features. Eco Blank mode allows presenters to blank the projection screen whenever they need to direct the audience's focus back on them - or simply when the projector is not in use. The SmartEco Mode cleverly adjusts the lamp power to maximize power savings by delivering the best contrast and brightness performance using only as much light as needed for the image/video being presented. No source detected mode switches the MX662 to Eco Blank Mode if the projector is left on for over three minutes without a display source. When inactive, the MX662 keeps power consumption to a minimum with 0.5W standby power. Insert a Wi-Fi dongle (sold separately) into the USB flash drive slot to display contents from your PC, MAC, iPhone and iPad to MX662 through the Wireless Display feature. USB Drive Display allows projection from a USB flash drive. Save the files you need onto a USB flash drive and insert it into the MX662 to start sharing. File types supported are JPEG, JPG, BMP, PNG, GIF and TIFF. Ecofacts: Arsenic-free optical glass, BFR/PVC-free casing plastics, PVC-free plastic packaging.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER


The MX662 is just the projector you need to perfect your presentation in all settings.

Featuring XGA resolution with 3500 ANSI lumens and 13000:1 high contrast ratio, the MX662 also offers multi-display for ultra-smooth connection, PC-less presentation and 3D-ready projection to keep your presentation looking great.

POWER SAVING, ECO FRIENDLY
WORLD-LEADING SMARTECO TECHNOLOGY FOR A GREENER ENVIRONMENT
As the first DLP brand to incorporate Philips' ImageCare technology into its projector lamp system, BenQ has taken a further leap, developing its own SmartEco Technology to perfect what DLP can do for energy saving in the 21st Century classroom. Built with this brand-new invention, the MX662 brings together uncompromised brightness, exquisite picture quality and optimized lamp life through innovative features.

The Eco Blank mode allows teachers to blank the projection screen whenever they need to direct their students' focus back on them–or simply when the projector is not in use. When activated, this special feature dims the lamp power automatically, lowering the total power consumption by 70%.

Lamp power is automatically adjusted 
to maximize saving. View larger SMARTECO MODE
The SmartEco Mode cleverly adjusts the lamp power to maximize power saving by delivering the best contrast and brightness performance using only as much light as needed.

NO SOURCE DETECTED MODE
The automatic switch to Eco Blank Mode after the projector is turned on for over three minutes without a display source, eliminating unnecessary energy waste and prolonging the life of the projector lamp.

AUDIO PASSTHROUGH
With the built-in speaker, the MX662 can be used as an audio system when it's in standby mode. This saves you the trouble, as well as the extra budget, of getting a separate audio system.

0.5W IN STANDBY MODE
When inactive, the MX662 keeps power consumption to a minimum with 0.5W standby power, achieving what was once a challenge for earlier projector models. This technological advancement in energy saving helps extend the projector lamp life and lower energy costs.

HASSLE-FREE PROJECTOR MAINTENANCE
Featuring an easy-to-access upper lamp door UPPER LAMP DOOR FOR EASY LAMP ACCESS
Kensington lock helps protect your projector The upper lamp door is designed for the managers to replace the projector lamp safely and quickly. Should the projector lamp go out in the middle of the class, it can be replaced without delaying the class.

KENSINGTON LOCK TO DISCOURAGE THEFT
A Kensington lock is designed to enable projector managers to secure their classroom projectors either to a ceiling mount or an audiovisual equipment cart, adding extra "physical" security to a classroom projector. BenQ's education projectors are each built with a security bar to help discourage opportunistic thieves.

THOUGHTFUL DESIGNS
AUTO POWER OFF
Featuring the plug-and-play convenience of USB connection Automatic power-off after the projector is turned on for over 30 minutes without a display source, eliminating unnecessary energy waste and prolonging the life of the projector lamp.

Wirelessly display your content on your PC, Mac, iPhone, and iPad WIRELESS DISPLAY
Insert a Wi-Fi dongle into the USB flash drive slot to display contents from your PC, Mac, iPhone, and iPad to the MX662 through the Wireless Display feature.

USB DISPLAY
USB Display offers the plug-and-play convenience of USB connection–with automatic resolution detection for the best image presentation and extension support for simultaneous multi-projection display.

PC-LESS TEACHING
USB Drive Display allows teachers to teach light with a USB flash drive. All they need to do is save the files they need onto a USB flash drive and insert it in the MX662 to start teaching. File types supported are JPEG, JPG, BMP, PNG, GIF, and TIFF.
